name: Juan Ruiz
university: The University of Texas at San Antonio
summary: Senior Mobile Engineer with 7+ years of experience designing, developing, and deploying high-performance iOS and Android applications using React Native, Flutter, Swift, and Kotlin. Skilled in end-to-end mobile app lifecycle, including architecture, CI/CD, automated testing, deployment, and post-launch optimization. Experienced in building offline-first architectures, integrating AI/ML-powered features, and optimizing app performance for responsive, reliable, and user-friendly experiences. Adept at collaborating with UX/UI teams, mentoring junior engineers, and delivering cross-platform mobile solutions for retail, insurance, logistics, and enterprise domains. Strong expertise in API design, cloud integration, push notifications, and mobile observability tools.
skills: translating UX/UI designs into mobile apps

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
bullets: Led development of cross-platform mobile applications using React Native and Flutter, delivering responsive and feature-rich iOS and Android apps with a focus on performance, reliability, and user experience.
Designed and implemented backend services in Node.js and Python (FastAPI) to support real-time data sync, push notifications, offline workflows, and AI-powered personalization features.
Architected and optimized local persistence and caching strategies to ensure seamless app behavior under variable network conditions, improving offline reliability and startup performance.
Integrated AI/ML models for predictive analytics, content personalization, and anomaly detection within mobile apps, maintaining low latency and smooth UI interactions.

Built and maintained CI/CD pipelines for mobile deployments using Jenkins, GitLab, and Fastlane, incorporating unit, integration, and end-to-end tests (Jest, Detox, XCTest, Espresso) to ensure app stability.
Applied advanced performance profiling and memory optimization, reducing app crashes and improving UI responsiveness across a range of devices.
Collaborated with UX/UI designers and product teams to translate wireframes into intuitive mobile interfaces, ensuring platform-consistent behavior.
Mentored junior mobile developers in cross-platform development patterns, native integration, testing best practices, and performance tuning.

experience.title: Senior Engineer II
bullets: Developed React Native and Swift-based mobile applications for financial and insurance services, delivering secure and user-friendly iOS and Android apps.
Designed mobile-focused APIs and data models in MongoDB for efficient storage and retrieval of dynamic policy, claims, and customer data.
Implemented offline-first workflows and caching mechanisms, ensuring app usability under low or intermittent network conditions.
Integrated asynchronous job queues and AI-powered predictive insights for claims processing, resource allocation, and operational efficiency.
Developed interactive UI components using React Hook Form and Material UI, providing real-time updates and seamless user experiences.
Conducted unit, integration, and E2E testing using Jest, Detox, and Espresso, improving reliability and reducing post-release issues.
Collaborated closely with cross-functional teams to align API design, business logic, and UX, ensuring seamless app functionality.

experience.title: Software Developer
bullets: Developed native and cross-platform mobile applications using React Native, Angular, and Swift, delivering dynamic user experiences across iOS and Android devices.
Designed RESTful APIs for authentication, role-based access, and dynamic data operations to support mobile app requirements.
Built interactive mobile UI components leveraging RxJS, React Hook Form, and Angular Material, ensuring smooth real-time updates and accessibility compliance.
Integrated third-party services for push notifications, analytics, file uploads, and payment processing, extending app functionality.
Implemented automated testing strategies with Jest, Detox, and XCTest, improving test coverage and reducing production issues.
Supported deployment on mobile CI/CD pipelines and contributed to version control best practices using Git.
